accessibility.header: Accessibility statement for 'Get help with your online immigration account'
accessibility.intro: This accessibility statement applies to the 'Get help with your online immigration account' service.
accessibility.intro-p1: This website is run by the Home Office. We want as many people as possible to be able to use this website. For example, that means you should be able to:
accessibility.intro-p1-li1: change colours, contrast levels and fonts
accessibility.intro-p1-li2: zoom in up to 300% without the text spilling off the screen
accessibility.intro-p1-li3: navigate most of the website using just a keyboard
accessibility.intro-p1-li4: navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
accessibility.intro-p1-li5: listen to most of the website using a screen reader (including the most recent versions of JAWS, NVDA and VoiceOver)
accessibility.intro-p2: We've also made the website text as simple as possible to understand.
accessibility.intro-p3-post-link: has advice on making your device easier to use if you have a disability.
accessibility.how-accessible-p1: We know some parts of this website are not fully accessible:
accessibility.how-accessible-p1-li1: Placeholder text for an accessibility issue
accessibility.feedback-p1: If you need information on this website in a different format like accessible PDF, large print, easy read, audio recording or braille:
accessibility.feedback-p2: We'll consider your request and get back to you in 14 days.
accessibility.reporting-header: Reporting accessibility problems with this website
accessibility.reporting-p1: We're always looking to improve the accessibility of this website. If you find any problems not listed on this page or think we're not meeting accessibility requirements, contact:
accessibility.reporting-p2-link: Read tips on contacting organisations about inaccessible websites.
accessibility.enforcement-p1-pre-link: The Equality and Human Rights Commission (EHRC) is responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018 (the 'accessibility regulations'). If you're not happy with how we respond to your complaint,
accessibility.enforcement-p1-link: contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).
accessibility.enforcement-p2: If you are in Northern Ireland and are not happy with how we respond to your complaint you can contact the Equalities Commission for Norther Ireland who are responsible for enforcing the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018(the 'accessibility regulations') in Northern Ireland.
accessibility.technical-info-header: Technical information about this website's accessibility
accessibility.technical-info-p1: The Home Office is committed to making its website accessible, in accordance with the Public Sector Bodies (Websites and Mobile Applications) (No. 2) Accessibility Regulations 2018.
accessibility.compliance-p1: This website is partially compliant with the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines version 2.1 AA standard, due to the non-compliances listed below.
accessibility.non-accessible-p1: The content listed below is non-accessible for the following reasons.
accessibility.non-compliance-li1: Placeholder text for an accessibility issue
accessibility.disproportionate-burden-p1: At this time, we have not made any disproportionate burden claims.
accessibility.outside-scope-header: Content that's not within the scope of the accessibility regulations
accessibility.outside-scope-p1: At this time, this service does not contain any content that is exempt from the regulations.
accessibility.preparation-p1: This statement was prepared on 17 December 2020. It was last reviewed on 17 December 2020.
accessibility.preparation-p2: This website was last tested on 16 December 2020. The test was carried out internally by the Home Office.
accessibility.preparation-p3: We tested the service based on a user's ability to complete key journeys. All parts of the chosen journeys were tested, including documents. Journeys were chosen on a number of factors including usage statistics, risk assessments and subject matter.
